page.title: 09The Finchley Carnival
page.content: This takes place at Victoria Park and lasts three days in mid July.In 1985 there was a circus theme with clowns,globe trotting,performing ponies and an escapologist. On the{Thursday},senior citizens and handicapped people are especially wlcomed.{Friday}is children's day with dancing,folk concert,fancy dress parade and baby competition. On{Saturday}the Carnival Procession leaves East End Road at 1.20pm with the Carnival Queen and her attendants at the head.Outside Victoria Park the Mayor of Barnet takes the salute and the procession continues to Tally Ho Corner.The floats make a colourful sight and the best ones win prizes.As they move along the streets those lining the route give money,which is given to local charities.The Carnival is a happy event for all ages.
